alert.note: Alert for Erie; Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 6:32AM EST until February 23 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. .There continues to be flooding on some slower responding rivers and creeks. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Rapids. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor flood, lowland flooding of farm areas along Tonawanda Creek between Rapids and the Tonawanda Indian Reservation. Flooding may impact Fletcher, Burdick, Kirby, and Tonawanda Creek Reservation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.3 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM EST Tuesday was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to lower below flood stage late this evening before possibly rising back above flood stage on Thursday. Rise above flood stage late Thursday morning and continue rising to 12.4 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.8 feet on 04/05/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 200 PM EST.
